It seems there is error in DOCTYPE declaration, that looks like 

<!DOCTYPE components PUBLIC "-//COMPANY//Generator config/EN" "jar:/resource/project-name/WebContent/WEB-INF/lib/generator.jar/META-INF/schema/config.dtd">.

But there is no reason to throw exception in separate message window, that hinders using the xml editor.
Denis, can you double-check that this meets the criteria for "critical"? https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/page.cgi?id=fields.html#bug_severity
Craig, any ideas on this?  While it's true that the string given won't form a proper URL, I can't figure out where in the stack this decision is supposed to be made, nor how it should be handled.

Looks like an exception is getting thrown and isn't caught until it perculates up to the running Job. I've added an additional 'catch' within this resolve method.  BTW, this resolve method is getting complicated.  I think we need to add more comments to explain.

I've checked a fix into HEAD (for ExtensibleURIResolver.java) but haven't released yet.

Moving severity to normal to reflect the definition accurately.
